concept.title: Indicating turning
concept.shortdesc: The direction indicators let you signal to other drivers which direction you intend to turn.

conbody.p: The direction indicators cause the indicator lights at the front and rear of the vehicle exterior to flash intermittently.
These are operated by the switch lever on the right hand side of the steering wheel.
The flashing direction indicators will only operate when the ignition is switched on.

ul.li: Move the switch lever upwards to operate the left-hand flashing indicator for turning left.
Move the switch lever downwards to operate the right-hand flashing indicator for turning right.

conbody.note: A warning light in the end of the switch lever indicates when a direction indicator is in use.
